apis.description: Get Availability: Returns availability stats for a cloud service. These stats are based on our own independent monitoring of each service. To monitor availability we have accounts and services provisioned with each provider and use Panopta to monitor availability. Panopta uses a very accurate multi-node outage verification process that virtually eliminates false outages and thereby provides reliable available metrics. Use the 'Get Services' and 'Get Providers' API methods for valid serviceId parameter values. If the response is an empty array, we may not have availability stats for the service yet (check https://cloudharmony.com/status for a list of services and regions that we currently monitor)

operations.notes: Returns availability stats for a cloud service. These stats are based on our own independent monitoring of each service. To monitor availability we have accounts and services provisioned with each provider and use Panopta to monitor availability. Panopta uses a very accurate multi-node outage verification process that virtually eliminates false outages and thereby provides reliable available metrics. Use the 'Get Services' and 'Get Providers' API methods for valid serviceId parameter values. If the response is an empty array, we may not have availability stats for the service yet (check https://cloudharmony.com/status for a list of services and regions that we currently monitor)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A JSON-P callback function to pad the response with (response is the first function argument). This parameter is added automatically by jQuery (i.e. jQuery.ajax, jQuery.getJSON) to work around cross site scripting (XSS) restrictions. Don't use this in the API sandbox

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: identifier of the service to return availability stats for - use the 'Get Services' or 'Get Provider' API method for a list of valid IDs

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: designates the number of days to return availability for. Default is 90

parameters.name: regions
parameters.description: if the service is available in multiple regions, this parameter may be used to filter the availability stats returned to only those for specific regions. For CDN and DNS services this parameter may be used to filter based on the location of monitoring nodes (valid options include: global, us_west, us_central, us_east, eu, asia, oceania and africa). For other cloud services it is used to filter based on service region (ServiceRegion::providerCode). For the latter - use the 'Get Service' API method for a list of valid regions

parameters.name: summarize
parameters.description: when used, a single ServiceAvailability object will be returned for each time interval and the availability metric will be across multiple regions

responseMessages.message: If the serviceId parameter does not reference a cloud service

apis.description: Get Bandwidth Pricing: Returns bandwidth pricing for a cloud service. Use the 'Get Services' and 'Get Providers' API methods for valid serviceId parameter values. Returns an empty array if we have not compiled pricing for the service or if pricing is not disclosed. The 'Get Service' API method includeds a 'hasBandwidthPricing' attribute designating whether or not bandwidth pricing is available for that service. The data model for this API method supports tiered and recurring bandwidth pricing models common for many services.

operations.notes: Returns bandwidth pricing for a cloud service. Use the 'Get Services' and 'Get Providers' API methods for valid serviceId parameter values. Returns an empty array if we have not compiled pricing for the service or if pricing is not disclosed. The 'Get Service' API method includeds a 'hasBandwidthPricing' attribute designating whether or not bandwidth pricing is available for that service. The data model for this API method supports tiered and recurring bandwidth pricing models common for many services.

parameters.description: identifier of the service to return bandwidth pricing for - use the 'Get Services' or 'Get Provider' API method for a list of valid IDs

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: bandwidth pricing for services is often different depending on the region where the service is provisioned in. For example, AWS EC2 is priced differently based on the region the VM is provisioned to. This parameter may be used to filter pricing returned to that of a specific provider region

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: some services price bandwidth differently based on where the data goes to. For example, AWS CloudFront bandwidth is priced higher if the client is located in South America or Australia. This parameter may be used to filter pricing to a specific endpoint region. It usually applies only to distributed services (i.e. CDN and DNS). Typically this parameter and 'region' are mutually exclusive and should not be used together in the same request

apis.description: Get Marketshare: Returns marketshare estimates for a given cloud service based on our marketshare analysis. To capture this information we periodically analyze websites of top Alexa 10k and Fortune 500 organizations and use a variety of techniques to correlate cloud services uses. The correlation techniques includes hotname patterns, IP/CIDR blocks and ASN matching in both primary and related hostnames including in CNAME chains. Known co-branded SaaS sites are excluded

CDN_Properties.description: Represents the properties, features and pricing for a content delivery network (CDN)

accessLimits.description: Does the provider support limiting access to content? Typically enabled using access tokens or validation webhooks

accessLimitsPrice.description: If the CDN supports access limits, and charges an extra fee to use it, this property designates the amount of that fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

comment.description: Our comments about these CDN properties

contentPull.description: In order to serve your content, a CDN must be able to access it. With content pull, the CDN edge pulls content from an HTTP accessible origin you maintain. This is also referred to as Reverse Proxy. It is the easiest and most common method supported by CDNs. A CDN will either support this or content push (or both)

contentPush.description: In order to serve your content, a CDN must be able to access it. With content push, the CDN provides a means (FTP, SCP, rsync, etc.) for you to upload content to a storage repository. This is also referred to as Edge Storage. This method is useful if you cannot (or do not desire to) maintain an HTTP origin server for your content. A CDN will either support this or content pull (or both)

currency.description: The currency for any pricing designated by these properties

edgePurging.description: Does the CDN allow you to manually remove or replace cached content before it expires? By default content is cached until a designated expiry time (set manually or via origin 'expires' headers). Expiry times for content may vary on different CDN edge servers. Edge purge is useful when you need to quickly remove or replace cached content from all CDN edge servers

edgeStoragePrice.description: If the CDN supports content push/edge storage, and charges a storage fee for its use, this property designates the amount of that fee per gigabyte. If set, the price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee. Alternatively, the storage service property may designate a separate storage service that facilitates edge storage and designates the associated costs (e.g. AWS CloudFront/S3)

estimatedPops.description: This property is set if the provider does not disclose the exact locations of the CDN points of presence (also referred to as POPs or edge servers), but has disclosed their numbers. Akamai is a prime example

logAccess.description: Does the CDN support access to federated server access logs? These are logs that have been compiled from all CDN edge servers where your content was accessed and stored on a user accessible storage platform

priceInterval.description: If the provider charges extra fees for any of the features described by these properties, this designates how often that fee is assessed. Most commonly these fees are monthly

routingMethod.description:
A CDN is a geographically distributed network of servers you can use to host web content. To improve performance, a CDN attempts to fulfill each request using an edge server that is physically or topologically close to the user it originates from. This property refers to the methods used by the CDN to make this determination. We independently analyze each CDN to determine the methods used. A CDN may employ multiple methods. The following are supported:
  • Edge Anycast allows a CDN to share a single IP address on multiple edge servers and automatically route users to the server that is topologically closest. When properly configured, Anycast edge routing provides many advantages over DNS including consistent optimal edge server selection, improved reliability due to quicker failover, and elimination of DNS dependencies. However, due to the cost and complexity of properly setting up and maintaining Anycast networks, is a less common method. Additionally, Anycast routing is often less reliable in less established Internet regions including Asia and South America.
  • DNS: The Domain Name System (DNS) resolves a textual hostname like www.google.com to a unique numeric address required by computers to communicate. A CDN may use DNS to route user requests to nearby edge servers by resolving your CDN hostname (e.g. cdn.mydomain.com) differently depending on where the user is located. This is the most common method for CDN edge routing because it is relatively easy to setup and administer. However, exclusive use of DNS edge routing can be prone to accuracy, reliability and performance issues. DNS edge routing relies on use of a Geo IP database to correlate IP addresses to geographical location, and these databases are often inaccurate. Additionally, the IP address the CDN sees for a DNS query is that of an intermediary DNS resolver (often belonging to the user's ISP) and not that of the user. The location of the user's DNS resolver - the basis by which edge routing decisions are made - may not be the same as the user. This discrepency can result in the user being routed to a more distant edge server. Reliability issues can also arise due to DNS caching. If a CDN edge server is taken out of service, users with cached DNS may continue to attempt to connect to it. To minimize DNS caching problems, a CDN may set low DNS cache times (e.g. 30 secs - 1 min as opposed to typical 1 hour+). However, doing so will require users to query DNS more frequently which can impact performance.
  • EDNS is an extension to the Domain Name System that allows intermediary DNS resolvers to include the user's IP address when submitting DNS queries. If supported, the CDN may use this information to determine the user's location (as opposed to that of the DNS resolver) in order to more accurately choose the closest CDN edge server. Because EDNS is new, support is still limited, but the largest public DNS services - Google Public DNS and OpenDNS - now support it.
  • Proprietary: Some CDN services use proprietary methods for edge server routing. These are often used in conjunction with standard DNS routing.
  • Anycast DNS: The Domain Name System (DNS) resolves a textual hostname like www.google.com to a unique numeric address required by computers to communicate. Anycast routing allows multiple servers to share a single IP address and automatically route users to the server that is topologically closest. Use of Anycast DNS means resolving your CDN hostname (e.g. cdn.mydomain.com) to an edge server IP address will be generally fast and reliable. Anycast DNS is fairly ubiquitous for CDNs, only minimally improves performance, and should not be confused with the much less common use of edge Anycast which impacts performance more significantly.

routingMethodComment.description: Our comments about the CDN service routing methods

serviceId.description: ID of the service these properties pertain to

sslCustomDomainIp.description: Does the CDN support traditional SSL content delivery using dedicated IPv4 addresses? This is often costly due to the number of IP addresses needed for each hostname

sslCustomDomainSni.description: Does the CDN support SNI based SSL content delivery? SNI is a newer SSL hosting method that allows a service to assign multiple SSL certificates to a single IP address. This reduces the associated costs, provisioning complexity and maintenance. However, SNI based SSL is not supported by older browsers

sslGenericDomain.description: Does the CDN support SSL content delivery using a generic domain name? This is a common feature allowing you to deliver content over SSL without purchasing an SSL certificate and paying extra for custom SSL

sslIpPrice.description: The price per hostname for SSL content delivery via dedicated IP addresses - if supported

sslSniPrice.description: The price per hostname for SSL content delivery via SNI - if supported

storageService.description: If the service supports content push/edge storage, this property may designate a separate storage service used to host your content

CloudProvider.description: Cloud providers are organizations that offer one or more cloud services: CDN, Compute, Database, DNS, PaaS or Storage

countries.description: The countries where this provider has a presence - either data centers or POPs

fortune500Rank.description: If this provider is a Fortune 500 company, this attribute defines its Fortune 500 rank

link.description: The URL we use to link to this cloud provider (if different from the website URL)

notes.description: Notes we've compiled about this provider

outageContacts.description: Newline separated list of contacts to use for outage notifications. Format is 'email' or 'name <email>'

regions.description: The regions where this provider has a presence - either data centers or POPs

serviceIds.description: Identifiers (i.e. serviceId) of the services this provider offers - array indexes are the same as serviceTypes

serviceTypes.description: Types of clouds services this provider offers - array indexes are the same as serviceIds

shortName.description: An optional short or abbreviated name we use for this provider

CloudService.description: Cloud services are computing resources (hardware and software) provided as a service over a network. These services include compute instances, storage, Internet content delivery, managed DNS, application and database hosting (platform-as-a-service / database-as-a-service)

beta.description: Is this cloud service currently designated beta or pre-release by the provider?

hasBandwidthPricing.description: Is bandwidth pricing available for this service?

hasDnsPricing.description: Is DNS pricing available for this service?

hasStorageOptions.description: Are storage options available for this (compute) service?

hasWebProbe.description: Does this cloud service have at least 1 public web probe? Web probes are used for the cloud network test

link.description: The URL we use to link to this cloud service (if different from the website URL)

notes.description: Notes we've compiled about this service

outageContacts.description: Newline separated list of contacts to use for outage notifications. Format is 'email' or 'name <email>'. If specified, overrides the provider contacts

pricingComment.description: Our comments about pricing for this service

providerId.description: ID of the cloud provider this service is offered by

regions.description: The regions where this service is available. For CDN and DNS services this signifies presence of a POP. For other cloud services it signifies data centers

shortName.description: An optional short or abbreviated name we use for this service

sla.description: The SLA (Service Level Agreement) for this cloud service represented as a percentage (e.g. 99.999%)

slaDescription.description: Description given by the provider for the service SLA

slaLink.description: URL to the provider's SLA documentation for this service - if available

type.description: The type of cloud service: CDN, Compute, Database, DNS, PaaS or Storage

ComputeInstanceTypePrice.description: Represents a pricing model associated with a compute instance type

billInterval.description: The minimum time interval used for billing - this may be different from the price interval (e.g. priced per month but billed per hour)

bwIncluded.description: The amount of Internet bandwidth in GB included at this price. Overage pricing should be defined using a Service Bandwidth Pricing record

currency.description: The currency this pricing is based on

label.description: Pricing label - used to group similar pricing models across multiple compute instance types - must be unique for each service and instance type

normalizedPrice.description: The total hourly price for the compute instance - the fields contains Price normalized to an hourly rate. For term pricing, the setup cost is added to the normalized hourly price for the duration of the term

normalizedTerm.description: The Term normalized to months (if applicable)

notes.description: Notes and observations about this pricing from CloudHarmony

operatingSystems.description: The operating systems this pricing record pertains to

osLicenseExcluded.description: Does pricing exclude the cost of operating system licensing (for commercial operating systems only)? If true, and users intend to use a paid operating system such as Windows or RHEL, additional licensing costs will be required

price.description: The recurring price (per occurrence of price interval)

priceInterval.description: The time interval for the price - the amount designated by price is charged for each occurence of this time interval

regions.description: If pricing is tied to specific provider regions - these are the identifiers of those regions (one region code per line)

serviceId.description: ID of the compute service this pricing pertains to

setup.description: Setup fee for this pricing model - optional

templateCpuCorePrice.description: If the compute instance is a template - how much of Price is for the designated number of CPU cores. If there is a charge for the OS, this can be designated by in Price (Price - Template CPU Core Price - Template Memory Price)

templateMemoryPrice.description: If the compute instance is a template - how much of Price is for the designated amount of memory. If there is a charge for the OS, this can be designated by in Price (Price - Template CPU Core Price - Template Memory Price)

term.description: If the provider requires a term commitment, this defines how long the recurring pricing is available once a contract is initiated (used often in conjunction with a setup fee) - optional

termInterval.description: The time interval for the term (e.g. month, year) - optional

termMinUsage.description: If the pricing is term based, and the provider requires a minimum usage commitment, this defines the minimum usage required as a percentage of the term interval - customers will be billed for this usage regardless of whether or not a compute instance is used - optional

turnedOffDiscount.description: Percentage of the recurring price discounted if a compute instance is turned off. For example - if 0, user pays full price regardless of whether instance is on or off. If empty, provider does not support turning instances off - optional

volumeDiscountMinTerm.description: The minimum term (months) for volume discounts (if applicable) - meaning customers must commit to a minimum monthly-spend for this many months in order to be eligible for the volume discounts

volumeDiscountMinTermAlt.description: An alternate minimum term (months) for volume discounts (if applicable)

volumeDiscountMinTermAltOffset.description: The discount offset if the alternate minimum term is used

volumeDiscountTermPrepayDiscount.description: Additional discount percentage when monthly-spend is pre-paid for the entire term (based on the Volume Discount Min Term)

volumeDiscountTier1.description: The minimum monthly invoice amount where a first tier volume discount is applied

volumeDiscountTier1Price.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the price for tier 1 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

volumeDiscountTier1Setup.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the setup for tier 1 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

volumeDiscountTier2.description: The minimum monthly invoice amount where a second tier volume discount is applied

volumeDiscountTier2Price.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the price for tier 2 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

volumeDiscountTier2Setup.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the setup for tier 2 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

volumeDiscountTier3.description: The minimum monthly invoice amount where a third tier volume discount is applied

volumeDiscountTier3Price.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the price for tier 3 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

volumeDiscountTier3Setup.description: Volume discount (percentage) of the setup for tier 3 volume - if null, discount data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

ComputeInstanceType.description: Represents a unique compute instance configuration available for deployment within a compute service

cpuCores.description: The number of CPU cores allocated for this compute instance

cpuModel.description: Optional CPU model for this compute instance - if explicitely disclosed by the provider (e.g. Intel Xeon E5-2620)

cpuSockets.description: The number of CPU sockets for this compute instance - if explicitely disclosed by the provider - cores per CPU can be determined by dividing CPU Cores by CPU Sockets

instanceId.description: Identifier used by the cloud provider to refer to this compute instance type - this value is unique for the associated compute service

legacy.description: Is this instance type considered legacy or previous generation (not recommended for new deployments)

localDiskRaid.description: Hardware raid level used for the local disks - if instance type includes hardware raid controller and provider discloses this information

localDiskRpm.description: Spindle RPM for local disks - if explicitely disclosed by the provider

localDiskType.description: Type of local disk used - if explicitely disclosed by the provider (e.g. SSD, SAS, SATA)

localDisks.description: Number of local storage disks allocated to this compute instance - if applicable (storage per disk = localStorage/localDisks)

localStorage.description: Amount of local storage in gigabytes included with this compute instance (across all disks) - if applicable

maxVolumes.description: If the service allows for multiple storage volumes to be attached to a compute instance - this defines the maximum number of such volumes. It may override the same setting for related storage services

maxVolumesWindows.description: If Max Volumes is different for windows - this may designate that difference

memory.description: The amount of memory in gigabytes allocated for this compute instance

name.description: The name of this compute instance type (as it is referred to by the provider)

networkLink.description: Optional network link speed designation (Mb/s) for the compute instance - applicable only when the provider sets and defines this characteristic

networkLinkDedicated.description: Is the network link dedicated for the compute instance (otherwise shared with other VMs on the same host)

notes.description: Notes and observations about this compute instance type from CloudHarmony

operatingSystems.description: Operating systems supported by this compute instance

pricing.description: Pricing details for this compute instance ordered by the normalized hourly price

quantityAvailable.description: If the provider has a limited quanity of compute instances of this type available - this is the number available

regions.description: Optional identifiers of specific regions where this compute instance is available (if it is not available in all regions designated for the compute service - one region code per line)

serviceId.description: References the id of the compute service this compute instance is available within

template.description: Is this compute instance type a template? Template instance types allow for definition of a single instance type that can scale up to a max capacity. Pricing associated with a compute instance template is linearly scalable. The template Instance ID and Name should use the dynamic strings {cpu} and {memory} which will be automatically replaced with the associated values. CPU Cores and Memory should represent the minimum configuration and pricing should be based on them.

templateMaxCpuCores.description: The max CPU cores for a compute instance template

templateMaxMemory.description: The max memory for a compute instance template

unavailable.description: Is this compute instance type currently unavailable (e.g. out of stock or discontinued)?

Compute_Properties.description: Represents the properties, features and pricing for a cloud compute service

comment.description: Our comments about these service properties

computeServiceId.description: Unique identifier for the record - typically the same as the service ID unless there are multiple

currency.description: The currency for any pricing designated by these properties

firewall.description: Does the compute service provide a user manageable firewall?

firewallForwardPrice.description: If the provider charges a fee per firewall port opening, this designates that fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

instanceTypes.description: The instance types supported by this compute service. Each value is a unique instance type identifier that either the provider or we have defined. For services with independent CPU/memory selections, we use a ratio of 2X memory (gigabytes) to CPU cores to define this list (up to max possible CPU cores or memory - e.g. 1 core/2GB, 2 cores/4GB...16 cores/32GB)

ipv4PerVm.description: Does the compute service provide at least one free IPv4 address per compute instance?

ipv4Price.description: The price for each extra IPv4 address assigned to a compute instance

ipv4Subnet25Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /25 IPv4 subnets (128 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet26Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /26 IPv4 subnets (64 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet27Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /27 IPv4 subnets (32 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet28Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /28 IPv4 subnets (16 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet29Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /29 IPv4 subnets (8 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet30Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /30 IPv4 subnets (4 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet31Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /31 IPv4 subnets (2 addresses), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4Subnet32Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /32 IPv4 subnets (1 address), this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv4TurnedOffPrice.description: The price for IPv4 addresses that are not assigned to assigned to compute instances that are powered down (if applicable)

ipv6.description: Does the compute service support IPv6 networking?

ipv6PerVm.description: Does the compute service provide at least one free IPv6 address per compute instance?

ipv6Price.description: The price for use of each (additional) IPv6 address

ipv6Subnet64Price.description: If the provider supports allocation of /64 IPv6 subnets, this is the associated fee. If set, price interval defines the billing frequency for this fee

ipv6TurnedOffPrice.description: The price for IPv6 addresses that are not assigned to assigned to compute instances that are powered down (if applicable)

loadBalancing.description: Does the compute service support network load balancing?

loadBalancingHealthChecks.description: Does the service support health checks and automatic failover in conjunction with load balancing?

loadBalancingTrafficPrice.description: If the provider charges an extra fee for load balanced network traffic - this designates the amount of that fee per gigabyte (GB)

multiIp.description: Does compute service allow you to assign multiple IP addresses to a single compute instance?

name.description: The name for this compute service

priceInterval.description: If the provider charges extra fees for any of the features described by these properties, this designates how often that fee is assessed. Most commonly these fees are hourly

regions.description: If these compute service properties pertain to specific service regions - these are the identifiers of those regions (one region per line)

resizing.description: Does the compute service allow instances to be resized after they have been provisioned?

serviceId.description: ID of the compute service this record pertains to

snapshotsCold.description: Does the compute service support cold snapshots (i.e. snapshots taken when the compute instance is powered off)?

snapshotsHot.description: Does the compute service support hot snapshots (i.e. snapshots taken when the compute instance is powered on)?

snapshotsPrice.description: Price per GB for storage volume snapshots

storageMaxSize.description: The maximum size per storage volume in terrebytes

storageMaxVolumes.description: The maximum number of storage volumes that can be attached to a compute instance (if a limit exists)

storagePrice.description: Price per GB  for compute instance storage

vpc.description: Does the compute service support virtual private cloud (VPC)? VPC allows users to create and deploy compute instances to logically or physically isolated networks

vpcPrice.description: The price for each VPC network

vpcVpn.description: Does the compute service support VPN connectivity to VPC networks?

vpcVpnPrice.description: The price for site-to-site VPN connections to service VPC networks (if supported)

Database_Properties.description: Represents the properties, features and pricing for a cloud database service

billInterval.description: The time interval used for billing (may be more granular than the priceInterval)

comment.description: Comment about this database service from CloudHarmony

cpu.description: Description of CPU resources allocated - applicable to 'resource' pricing methods only

currency.description: The currency the database pricing is based on

databaseType.description: The type of database (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL)

dbServiceId.description: Unique identifier for the record - typically the same as the service ID unless there are multiple

highAvailability.description: Does the service support high availability features like clustering, replicas, read-only slaves at this pricing tier?

label.description: Pricing label - a short descriptor of the pricing model

maxConnections.description: The maximum number of server connections allowed at this pricing tier - applicable to 'resource' pricing methods only

maxDatabases.description: The maximum number of unique databases that may be created at this pricing tier (null for unlimited)

memory.description: Memory resources (gigabytes) allocated at this pricing tier - applicable to 'resource' pricing methods only

multiTenant.description: Are the database servers shared with multiple users at this pricing tier (as opposed to dedicated)?

normalizedPrice.description: The total hourly price - calculated by combining price and setup normalized to an hourly rate (setup normalized to the term specified)

numberOfHosts.description: The number of clustered or master/slave hosts used at this pricing tier (>1 generally implies better high availability)

opsIncluded.description: Number of operations (of any type) included at this pricing tier - applicable to 'metered' pricing methods only

platformServices.description: Service IDs referencing platform services that this database is available for as an add-on

price.description: Price for this database usage tier - this amount is billed for usage every price interval (billing interval may be different)

priceInterval.description: Time interval for the price - the amount designated by price is charged for each occurence of this time interval

pricePer100kOps.description: The price for 100,000 database operations - used when provider does not distinguish between operation type (i.e. read and write ops are the same) - applicable to 'metered' pricing methods only

pricePer100kReadOps.description: The price for 100,000 database read operations - applicable to 'metered' pricing methods only

pricePer100kSmallOps.description: The price for 100,000 database small operations (e.g. count) - applicable to 'metered' pricing methods only

pricePer100kWriteOps.description: The price for 100,000 database write operations - applicable to 'metered' pricing methods only

priceScaling.description: Does the price scale linearly? Meaning, 2X price (and setup) will provide 2X of the applicable resources (based on the pricing methods)

priceScalingCap.description: If the price scales linearly, what is the maximum multiples of price (and thus maximum resources) supported?

pricingMethods.description: The pricing method(s) used for the database service - resources (cpu, memory, networkLimit, maxConnections, numberOfHosts, readCache), storage (rowLimit, storageIncluded, storageLimit, storageOveragePrice), metered (opsIncluded, pricePer100kOps, pricePer100kReadOps, pricePer100kSmallOps, pricePer100kWriteOps), or throughput (throughput, throughputInterval, throughputPerRecord, throughputPrice, throughputPriceInterval, throughputRead, throughputReadPrice, throughputRecordSize, throughputWrite, throughputWritePrice) - a database service may use 1 or more pricing methods

readCache.description: The amount of in-memory read cache (megabytes) is provided at this pricing tier - applicable to 'resource' pricing methods only

regions.description: If pricing is tied to specific provider regions - these are the identifiers of those regions (one region code per line)

rowLimit.description: Number of rows included for the monthly price at this pricing tier - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only

rowsIncluded.description: The number of rows included for the monthly price at this pricing tier - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only

rowsOverage.description: Price per 100k additional rows above what is included at the base price (cost for 100k rows above the included amount - based on the same price interval) - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only

serviceId.description: ID of the service this database is associated with - either a DbaaS or PaaS

setup.description: Setup fee for this pricing model - optional

storageIncluded.description: The amount of storage in gigabytes included for the monthly price at this pricing tier - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only

storageLimit.description: The maximum storage in gigabytes that may be used at this pricing tier - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only, and only when overage is supported

storageOveragePrice.description: Price per gigabyte of database storage/month above what is included at the base price (cost for storage above the included amount - based on the same price interval) - applicable to 'storage' pricing methods only

term.description: If the provider requires a term commitment, this defines how long the recurring pricing is available once a contract is initiated (used often in conjunction with a setup fee) - optional

termInterval.description: The time interval for the term (e.g. month, year) - optional

throughput.description: Used in place of throughputRead and throughputWrite if provider does not distinguish between type of operation - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputInterval.description: The time interval at which the provisioned read and write throughput limits are applied - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputPerRecord.description: Is throughput calculated based on number of records involved in a request (as opposed to number of requests)? - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputPrice.description: Price for read and write throughput - used when provider does not distinguish between operation types - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputPriceInterval.description: The time interval at which the provisioned read and write throughput prices are applied - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputRead.description: The number of provisioned read operations allowed at the throughput interval designated - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputReadIncluded.description: Amount of read throughput included at this pricing tier - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputReadPrice.description: Price for the read throughput designated

throughputRecordSize.description: The record size in kilobytes to use when calculating throughput requirements - used if throughput is per record (as opposed to per request) - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputWrite.description: The number of provisioned write operations allowed at the throughput interval designated - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputWriteIncluded.description: Amount of write throughput included at this pricing tier - applicable to 'throughput' pricing methods only

throughputWritePrice.description: Price for the write throughput designated

DNS_Properties.description: Represents the properties, features and pricing for a DNS service

currency.description: The currency this pricing is based on

dnsServiceId.description: Unique identifier for the record - typically the same as the service ID unless there are multiple

dnssecManagement.description: Method used by provider for supporting Domain Name Security Extensions/DNSSEC management (if supported) - if empty, service does not support DNSSEC

healthChecksMinInterval.description: The minimum interval in minutes that is supported for health checks

healthFailoverComment.description: Optional comment by CloudHarmony about this provider's health check failover feature

healthFailoverName.description: Name used by provider to refer to health checking failover feature (if applicable) - if empty, service does not support this feature

healthFailoverPrice.description: Monthly price (per record) for use of the health checks failover feature

healthLoadBalancingComment.description: Optional comment by CloudHarmony about this provider's health check load balancing feature

healthLoadBalancingName.description: Name used by provider to refer to health checking load balancing feature (if applicable) - if empty, service does not support this feature

healthLoadBalancingPrice.description: Monthly price (per record) for use of the health checks load balancing feature

monthlyZoneHostingFee.description: The monthly fee charged for each zone hosted by the DNS service (if provider charges per zone monthly fee)

monthlyZoneHostingFeeComment.description: Optional comment by CloudHarmony about this provider's monthly zone hosting fee

name.description: Name for this DNS pricing - unique for a service

notes.description: Custom notes and observations about this pricing from CloudHarmony

pricing.description: Represents pricing for use of this DNS service

primaryXfrSupport.description: If this DNS service supports operating as a Primary - this field designates whether it supports NOTIFY (primary to secondary change notification), AXFR (full zone transfer), IXFR (incremental zone transfer) and TSIG (Transaction SIGnature). At a minimum, if supported, this field will designate AXFR (polling) support

routingLocationBasedComment.description: Optional comment by CloudHarmony about this provider's location based routing feature

routingLocationBasedEdns.description: Does location based routing support EDNS (IP forwarding from the name server)?

routingLocationBasedName.description: Name used by provider to refer to location based routing (uses Geo IP lookup) feature (if applicable) - if empty, service does not support this feature

routingLocationBasedPrice.description: Monthly price (per record) for use of the location based routing feature - if priced by query volume, will be defined using separate pricing tiers for this query type

routingZoneBasedComment.description: Optional comment by CloudHarmony about this provider's zone based routing feature

routingZoneBasedName.description: Name used by provider to refer to zone based routing (uses Anycast IP zones) feature (if applicable) - if empty, service does not support this feature

routingZoneBasedPrice.description: Monthly price (per record) for use of the zone based routing feature - if priced by query volume, will be defined using separate pricing tiers for this query type

secondaryXfrSupport.description: If this DNS service supports operating as a Secondary - this field designates whether it supports NOTIFY (change notifications from primary), AXFR (full zone transfer), IXFR (incremental zone transfer) and TSIG (Transaction SIGnature). At a minimum, if supported, this field will designate AXFR (polling) support

serviceId.description: ID of the DNS service this pricing pertains to - a DNS service may have multiple pricing structures

DNS_PricingTier.description: Represents the price for 1 million DNS queries - optionally tiered based on volume

cap.description: Maximum blocks of 1 million DNS queries at which this price is billed (if usage exceeds this amount, the next highest tier is billed) - if null, this is the highest usage tier

capText.description: User friendly text for Cap (e.g. 1 billion)

comment.description: Comment about this pricing tier from CloudHarmony

maxResourceRecords.description: The maximum number of resource records permitted for this price

monthlyFee.description: Optional monthly fee charged for this usage tier (in addition to query usage charges)

planName.description: The name of this DNS price plan

price.description: The price for 1 million DNS queries at this usage tier (or overage for plan based pricing) - if null, pricing data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)

priceText.description: User friendly text for Price - may be used to display price ranges when price may vary depending on other factors (e.g. $865-1200)

queryType.description: Optional specialized type of query that this pricing tier applies to

zonesAllowed.description: If the provider couples zones (domains) to pricing tiers - this is the number of zones included for free with this pricing tier

ids.description: An array of identifiers (e.g. providerId or serviceId)

MarketshareSnapshot.description: Summarized marketshare for a specific type of list (e.g. Alexa 10k, Fortune 500), cloud service type (e.g. CDN, DNS, compute) and snapshot date. This object contains a list of services and their associated marketshare totals within the list on the date the snapshot was taken.

listDate.description: The date that this list was compiled. For Alexa, this is the date that the list was downloaded. For Fortune 500, this is June 1 of the year the list pertains to (e.g. 6/1/2014 = Fortune 500 2014)

listName.description: The name of the list this marketshare summary pertains to

listSize.description: The total number of hostnames/companies in the list

listType.description: The type of list this snapshot pertains to: Alexa 1k, Alexa 10k or Fortune 500

marketshare.description: Array of marketshare tallies for each service. This is the total number of hostnames/companies in the list associated with each service. Marketshare tallies are determined using a variety of methods including IP, ASN and hostname correlation. Related hostnames and CNAME chains are taken into account when tallying marketshare. The indeces in this array corresponds to the indeces in services.

marketshareChanges.description: The marketshare change for each service between this and the prior marketshare snapshot (if available). If unknown the values in this array will be null. The indeces in this array corresponds to the indeces in services.

percentages.description: The marketshare percentage for each service. This is the service tally divided by the list size. The indeces in this array corresponds to the indeces in services.

ranks.description: The ranking of each service based on all of the services of this type and list that we track marketshare for. A value of 1 is the highest ranking service. The indeces in this array corresponds to the indeces in services.

serviceType.description: The type of cloud service this marketshare snapshot pertains to (e.g. CDN, DNS)

services.description: Array of services (service IDs) for each marketshare tally. The indeces in this array corresponds to the indeces in marketshare, marketshareChanges, percentages and ranks.

servicesIncluded.description: The total number of services included in this snapshot. This is also the upper limit on marketshare ranks.

snapshotDate.description: The date that the marketshare snapshot was taken

CH_NetworkTestParams.description: Parameters for network testing - based on definition of CloudHarmony web probes

test_provider.description: One or more test provider names

test_provider_id.description: One or more test provider IDs

test_region.description: One or more test service regions

test_service.description: One or more test service names

test_service_id.description: One or more test service IDs

test_service_type.description: One or more test service types

Platform_Properties.description: Represents the unique features, properties and pricing associated with a platform-as-a-service (PaaS)

apiRestricted.description: Are language APIs or libraries restricted, limited or customized (e.g. restricted networking API access)?

autoFailover.description: Does the platform support automatic failover if an application (VM based) or process (process based) host fails?

autoScaling.description: Does service support autoscaling. For process based platforms this signifies an automatic increase in the number of processes when demand increases. For VM based platforms, this signifies automatic increase in VM resource allocation.

currency.description: The currency the platform pricing is based on

instanceTypes.description: For VM based platforms only - the instance types supported by this platform service. Each value is a unique instance type identifier that either the provider or we have defined

platformId.description: Identifier for this platform - same as Service ID

priceMonthly.description: Flat monthly fee for use of this platform (in addition to process or VM based charges)

processBased.description: Process based platforms deploy applications using on-demand or dedicated processes (may also be referred to as workers, threads or another name). Each process generally runs in an isolated container that provides memory, (ephemeral) storage and CPU capacity. Multiple processes for the same application may run on different hosts. While process based platforms are often more constrained than VM based platforms (e.g. ephemeral storage, API limitations), they often provide better scalability and fault tolerance

processName.description: The name or term used by the provider to refer to platform processes (e.g. dyno, worker - only applicable to process based platforms)

processPricing.description: Pricing for platform processes (for process based platforms - VM based platforms use compute instance pricing)

processStorageEphemeral.description: Is process storage erased when a platform process ends (only applicable to process based platforms)?

selfHostable.description: Does the provider offer a self hostable option that simulates/duplicates the platform features and functionality, whereby users can deploy applications to other infrastructure (only applicable to process based platforms)?

serviceId.description: ID of the cloud service this record is associated with

sslCustomDomainIp.description: Does the provider support standard SSL certificates for custom domains (requires a dedicated IP address)?

sslCustomDomainSni.description: Does the provider support SNI SSL certificates for custom domains (SNI certificates allow multiple custom domains to be hosted from a single IP address)

sslGenericDomain.description: Does the service support SSL via a generic provider domain?

sslIpPrice.description: The monthly price for standard custom domain SSL certificates - if supported (dedicated IP address)

sslSniPrice.description: The monthly price for SNI custom domain SSL certificates - if supported

supportedDatabases.description: Databases supported for applications deployed to this platform

supportedLanguages.description: Programming languages supported for applications deployed to this platform

vmBased.description: VM based platforms facilitate deployment and management of applications on platform VM instances where they run similar to a VM/virtual host type environment. Generally, libraries and APIs, storage access and other functionality will be similar to self hosting, but the provider will configure and maintain platform VMs. Users typically have limited or no user login access. VM based platforms often do not offer autoscaling and failover capabilities because applications are deployed to a specific VM and if that VM fails, the applications running on it will also fail.

Platform_Pricing.description: Represents pricing for a process based platform-as-a-service (PaaS)

comment.description: Comment about this pricing from CloudHarmony

cpu.description: The amount of CPU resources allocated to each process at this pricing tier (if provider offers a description of CPU resources - only applicable to process based platforms)

freeProcesses.description: The number of processes included with this platform pricing tier

memory.description: The amount of memory available to each process in megabytes at this pricing tier (may be a soft limit - only applicable to process based platforms)

price.description: The price charged for each process and price interval

priceInterval.description: The time interval applied to price - the amount designated by price is charged for each process and occurence of this time interval

processName.description: The name or term used by the provider to refer to platform processes (e.g. dyno, worker, service instance)

processType.description: The type of process this pricing pertains to - backend, frontend or all

reservePrice.description: An optional discounted price for reserved processes - applicable when provider offers autoscaling and customer commits to maintain and pay for a full time process

storage.description: The amount of storage available to each process in GB at this pricing tier - 0 for none, -1 for unlimited or unknown. Process storage is generally ephemeral and coupled to a specific process (only applicable to process based platforms)

SearchRecord.description: Represents a single cloud offering - one of: compute instance type, service region, service, provider, or service type

id.description: The identifier for this search record - one of: [service ID]-[instance type], [service ID]-[region], [service ID], [provider ID] or [service type]

name.description: Name for the search record - one of: [service name] - [instance type], [service name] - [region], [service name], [provider name] or [service type]

providerId.description: Optional provider ID this search record pertains to. Set for all record types except service_type

region.description: Optional region this search record pertains to. Set for service_region records only

serviceId.description: Optional service ID this search record pertains to. Set for all record types except service_type and provider

serviceTypes.description: Service types for this search record. For provider type records, this may contain multiple comma separated values for each service type offered

type.description: The search record type - one of: compute_instance, provider, service, service_region or service_type

webProbes.description: Number of publicly accessible web probes for this search record

ServiceAvailability.description: Represents availability of a cloud service over a period of time

availability.description: Availability of the cloud service for the designated time period represented as a percentage (e.g. 99.997)

availabilityCalculated.description: Calculated availability of the cloud service for the designated time period represented as a percentage (e.g. 99.997)

days.description: The number of days this availability metric represents. This may not be the same as the difference between start and stop if monitoring for this service began later. The availability metric is based on the difference betweens start and stop

downtime.description: The total downtime for the designated time interval in seconds

downtimeScheduled.description: The scheduled downtime for the designated time interval in seconds

outages.description: The total number of outages that occurred during the designated time period

outagesScheduled.description: The number of scheduled outages that occurred during the designated time period

region.description: For CDN and DNS (distributed) services - this attribute represents the geographical region where the monitoring agents reside. For other cloud services it represents the service region (data center) that the availability metric pertains to

serviceId.description: The ID of the service this availability metric pertains to

start.description: The exact start time for this availability metric

stop.description: The exact stop time for this availability metric

BandwidthPricing.description: Used to describe bandwidth pricing for a cloud service including ingress and egress Internet bandwidth and tiered pricing models

billingRegions.description: Some services charge differently for bandwidth depending on your billing address (e.g. HP Cloud CDN). If this is the case, this attribute represents the billing address geographical regions this pricing pertains to

comment.description: Our comments about this bandwidth pricing

currency.description: Currency the pricing is based on

endpointRegions.description: Some services price differently based on where the bandwidth goes to or comes from. This method of pricing often applies to distributed services - CDN and DNS. If bandwidth is priced in this way, this attribute designates which geographical endpoint regions this pricing pertains to

pricingTiers.description: An array of sub-objects that describe the bandwidth pricing. If pricing is tiered or priced differently between ingress and egress, multiple sub-objects will be present in this attribute. The sub-objects in this array will be sorted by 'cap' or 'price' in ascending order

regions.description: Bandwidth pricing for services is sometimes different depending on the region where the service is provisioned in. If bandwidth is priced in this way, this attribute designates the provider regions this pricing pertains to. For a CDN, if this attribute is set, it signifies the POPs (points of presence) the pricing pertains to

regionsExcluded.description: Similar to the 'regions' attribute but designates provider regions this pricing is excluded from. For a CDN, if this attribute is set, it signifies the POPs (points of presence) the pricing does not pertain to

BandwidthPricingTier.description: Used to describe a single bandwidth pricing tier. Often bandwidth pricing consist of multiple tiers

cap.description: Used for tiered bandwidth pricing models - the maximum bandwidth in gigabytes per month that this pricing tier pertains to. If bandwidth exceeds this cap, the next higher tier will be used. If this attribute is not set, this pricing is for the highest usage tier. Tiered bandwidth pricing is ordered on this attribute

cdnEdgeStorage.description: For CDN services that bundle bandwidth and edge storage - the amount of edge storage (gigabytes) included with this bandwidth pricing tier

cdnZonesIncluded.description: For CDN services that bundle bandwidth and zones - the number of zones included with this bandwidth pricing tier

cdnZonesPrice.description: For CDN services that charge extra for zones (when the number of zones exceeds CDN Zones Includes) - the cost for additional zones

cdnZonesPriceInterval.description: The billing frequency for the additional CDN zones price (if not set, Price Interval assumed)

comment.description: Our own comments about this bandwidth pricing tier

egress.description: Does this pricing tier apply to egress/outbound bandwidth?

gbIncluded.description: If this pricing tier is for a fixed recurring amount (e.g. $10/month) - this attribute designates the number of gigabytes included during each Price Interval for 'price'. If your bandwidth exceeds this amount, Price Per GB would be charged for overage

ingress.description: Does this pricing tier apply to ingress/inbound bandwidth?

interRegion.description: Does this pricing tier apply to inter-region bandwidth (i.e. bandwidth between provider regions)?

internet.description: Does this pricing tier apply to Internet bandwidth (i.e. bandwidth that leaves the provider's network)?

intraRegion.description: Does this pricing tier apply to intra-region bandwidth (i.e. bandwidth that stays within a provider region)?

intraSubRegion.description: Does this pricing tier apply to intra-subregion/availability zone bandwidth (i.e. bandwidth that stays within a provider sub-region or availability zone)?

normalizedPrice.description: If this pricing tier is for a fixed recurring amount - this is the derived per GB price for bandwidth (i.e. price/gbIncluded)

price.description: If this pricing tier is for a fixed recurring amount - this designates the recurring price for every priceInterval. If set gbIncluded designates the number gigabytes included for this price

priceInterval.description: If this pricing tier is for a fixed recurring amount - this designates the frequency that price will be charged

pricePer10kRequest.description: If an additional charge is assessed per HTTP request, this designates what that charge is per 10,000 requests

pricePer10kRequestHttps.description: If an additional charge is assessed per HTTPS request, this designates what that charge is per 10,000 requests

pricePerGB.description: The price per gigabyte of bandwidth. If this pricing tier is for a fixed recurring amount (i.e. the 'price' attribute is set), this designates the cost for bandwidth exceeding gigabytes includes. If neither 'price' nor this attribute are set, pricing is not disclosed (contact the provider for pricing)

NetworkIdentifier.description: Describes an identifier for a service network. This is an IP/CIDR, CNAME, ASN, ISP or some other network related value that may be used to associated a service to an network IP or hostname

city.description: City associated with the service region this identifier pertains to (if known)

country.description: Country associated with the service region this identifier pertains to (if known)

fromConfig.description: Did this identifier come from an explicit configuration or was it dynamically generated from known hostnames/IP addresses

identifier.description: The network identifier value. How this is used to make service associations will depend on the type. For CNAME type identifiers this value may be a regular expression if enclosed by forward slash. For ISP and ORG type identifiers this value is based on the MaxMind IP database

providerId.description: The ID of the provider this identifier pertains to

region.description: Optional region - set if this identifier is specific to a particular service region

serviceId.description: ID of the service thid network identifier pertains to

serviceType.description: The type of service this network identifier pertains to

skip.description: Skip correlations based on this network identifier

state.description: State/province associated with the service region this identifier pertains to (if known)

type.description: The type of network identifier this is - either an IP + CIDR, DNS name servers, CNAME fragment, ASN, ISP or organization name

ServiceOutage.description: Represents the data associated with a service outage

downtime.description: The total downtime for this outage in seconds

logs.description: Optional logs/comments about this outage from the provider or us

notified.description: Has vendor been notified about the outage?

region.description: For CDN and DNS (distributed) services - this attribute represents the geographical region where the outage occurred. For other cloud services it represents the service region (data center) that the outage pertains to

resolved.description: Has this outage been resolved or is it still ongoing?

serviceId.description: The ID of the service this outage pertains to

ServiceOutageLog.description: Represents a single log or comment for an outage from the provider or us

entry.description: The comment for this outage log

timestamp.description: When this outage log was created

ServiceRegion.description: Represents a geographical location where a cloud provider maintains infrastructure for cloud services (e.g. location of a compute region or CDN PoP)

city.description: City where this region is located

country.description: Country where this region is located (ISO 3166 country codes use - e.g. US)

estimated.description: true if the location of this region is estimated (some providers do no disclose exact locations)

facilities.description: The number of facilities (i.e. availability zones or POPs) in this region

notes.description: Notes we've compiled about this region

planned.description: Is this a planned region (not currently live)?

providerCode.description: The identifier we use to reference this region in benchmarks. We generally use the same identifiers as the provider if they use them (e.g. us-east-1)

regions.description: Identifiers of the geographical regions this service region pertains to

special.description: true if access to or use of this region is restricted or limited - for example, AWS GovCloud

state.description: State or province where this region is located (US or Canada)

ServiceStatus.description: Represents the current availability status of a cloud service

checked.description: When the service status was last checked

downSince.description: If the service is down, this represents the time when the downtime began

region.description: The service region this status represents. For CDN and DNS this signifies the monitoring location (global, us_west, us_central, us_east, eu, asia, oceania or africa). For other services it represents the service region being monitored.

serviceId.description: The identifier of the service this status pertains to

Storage_Properties.description: Represents the unique properties, features and pricing for a storage service

block.description: Does this storage support block level access (i.e. mounting drives)

comment.description: Comment about this storage service from CloudHarmony

computeOptionId.description: For block storage services - identifier used to reference this storage service when used in conjunction with a compute instance for benchmarking. If the storage service supports provisioned IOPS, this identifier may contain an optional dynamic string {iops} for the number of IOPS actually provisioned

computePrice.description: For block storage services - optional price added (based on the price interval specified) to compute instances for use of this storage service

computeServiceId.description: For block storage services - compute service that this storage service may be used by

computeThroughput.description: For block storage services - the throughput capacity (megabits/sec) between compute instances and the storage platform - if provider discloses this information

currency.description: The currency any service pricing is based on

diskRpm.description: Spindle RPM speed of the hard disks used by the provider for this storage service - if the provider discloses this information

diskType.description: Type of hard disks used by the provider for this storage service - if the provider discloses this information

geoReplicas.description: Does the service make geographically disperse replicas of data stored within this storage service - if the provider discloses this information

instanceIds.description: For block storage services assocated with a compute service - if this storage service is limited to a subset of the compute instance types, these are the instance IDs of those types (one instance ID per line) - regular expressions are ok (e.g. /vmware$/)

iopsBlockSize.description: For block storage services - the block size in kilobytes that the IOPS values (Max IOPS and Price Per Provisioned IOPs) are based on (e.g. 16KB)

maxIops.description: For block storage services - the maximum number of IOPS supported for the storage service and compute instance - if provisioned IOPs is supported, this is the max number of IOPs that may be provisioned

maxVolumeSize.description: For block storage services - the maximum size per volume in terrebytes (if limited by the provider)

maxVolumes.description: For block storage services - the maximum number of distinct volumes that can be attached (if limited by the provider)

maxVolumesWindows.description: For block storage services - the maximum number of distinct volumes that can be attached specifically to Windows compute instances (specified only if different for Windows compared to other operating systems)

normalizedComputePrice.description: Compute Price normalized to an hourly rate

object.description: Does this storage support object based access (i.e. API access)

priceInterval.description: The time interval for the compute price - the amount designated by the compute price is charged for each occurence of this time interval

pricePer10kArchive.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 Archive requests - for archival storage services only, empty if not supported

pricePer10kCopy.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 COPY requests - empty if not supported

pricePer10kDelete.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 DELETE requests

pricePer10kGet.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 GET requests

pricePer10kHead.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 HEAD requests

pricePer10kList.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 LIST requests

pricePer10kOps.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 operations regardless of type. Applicable for services that do not separate pricing based on type of operation - or for services that charge an additional operation charge

pricePer10kPost.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 POST requests

pricePer10kPut.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 PUT requests

pricePer10kRetrieve.description: For object storage services - price per 10,000 Retrieve requests - for archival storage services only - blank if not supported

pricePerGB.description: The price for storage usage per gigabyte for this service for each occurrence of the price interval - may be used in place of sub-pricing elements for simple (i.e. non-tiered) pricing models

pricePerMillionIo.description: For block storage services - price per 1 million I/O operations (if provider charges based on IO)

pricePerProvisionedIops.description: For block storage services with provisioned IOPS support - price per pre-provisioned IOPS based on the price interval

pricePerSnapshotGB.description: For block storage services with snapshot support - price per gigabyte for volume snapshots (hot or cold) based on the price interval - only specify if different from regular storage pricing and/or from the storage pricing for the referenced Snapshot Storage Service

pricing.description: Represents the possibly tiered pricing for storage usage

provisionedIops.description: For block storage services - does service support pre-provisioning/allocation of IOPS?

raidLevel.description: Raid level used by the provider for this storage service - if the provider discloses this information

regions.description: If storage service/settings are specific provider regions, these are the identifiers of those regions (one region code per line)

replicas.description: Does the service make locally replicas of data stored within this storage service - if the provider discloses this information?

serviceId.description: ID of the storage service this record pertains to

snapshotServiceId.description: For block storage services with snapshot support - optional ID of another storage service that volume snapshots are stored in

snapshotsCold.description: For block storage services - does service support cold volume snapshots?

snapshotsHot.description: For block storage services - does service support hot volume snapshots?

storageServiceId.description: Unique identifier for the record - service ID followed by an optional dash and short identifier (if multiple for a given service)

StoragePricingTier.description: Represents the cost of storage for a storage service based on an optional usage tier

cap.description: Maximum storage in gigabytes available at this price tier (if usage exceeds this amount, the next highest tier is used) - if empty, this is the highest usage tier

capText.description: User friendly text for Cap (e.g. 450 TB)

comment.description: Comment about this price tier from CloudHarmony

includedGB.description: The amount of storage in gigabytes included for the Price at this usage tier

normalizedPrice.description: Price normalized to an hourly rate per TB

price.description: Optional recurring price for this usage tier - this amount is charged for each occurrence of the Price Interval

priceInterval.description: The time interval for prices in this record - the amount designated by the prices are charged for each occurence of this time interval

pricePerGB.description: The price of storage per gigabyte for this usage tier (or for overages if Price and GB Included are set) - if empty, pricing data is not disclosed (customers should contact the provider)
